results.title: Nikko: autumn in Japan's alpine playground
results.brief_description: Describes and illustrates autumn in Nikko, Japan’s alpine playground. Shows various outdoor activities on Lake Chunzenji.

results.title: Drink no Longer Water
results.creator_credit: Australian Wine and Brandy Corporation and Fontana Films
results.brief_description: A humourous romp through various wine styles set in the country in a castle-like structure. Vignettes played out by actors - some in period costume to emulate the character of various wine varieties/styles from Moselle “for first lovers” through to claret are you old enough? Featuring Australian actors Steve Bisley and Mel Gibson in their youth.

results.title: What little girls are made of (TEFC)
results.brief_description: For over a century male scientists have been searching for evidence to demonstrate female inferiority. This program explores this idea and the effect it has had on the relationship between women and science.
results.description: For over a century male scientists have been searching for evidence to demonstrate female inferiority. This program explores this idea and the effect it has had on the relationship between women and science.

results.title: Here They Know You
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “School’s Out”.
In country towns, opportunities for school leavers are limited. Diane and Peter have left school but don’t have jobs. They reflect on the relevance of school, the sense of community in a country town and the advantages of city and country life

results.title: Solar dawn (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Kay Roberts, Gareth Cole and Solarscope Films
results.brief_description: Utilises many animation sequences to clearly show how basic solar collectors work. It shows how buildings can be heated and cooled by solar devices, and how city buildings and ordinary houses should be designed to take advantage of direct solar energy.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Kay Roberts, Gareth Cole and Solarscope Films

results.title: You Just Don't Realise
results.creator_credit: Paul Saunders, Philippe de Montignie and Eyewitness News
results.brief_description: In Australia, where there is one vehicle for every three people, road accidents have reached epidemic proportions with 4,000 people dying each year. The trauma of the accidents themselves is only eclipsed by the trauma of the chain of events that follow. Highly graphic scenes of car accidents in this film make viewing unsuitable for sensitive people, and preview is strongly recommended

results.title: Liquid Sun (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Apace Research and Sydney University Television Services
results.brief_description: The production of power alcohol from farm crops, and its uses as motor fuel is causing great interest in Australia. It is a major challenge facing primary producers and could be an economic proposition in many areas

results.title: Half and Half
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “School’s Out”.
Prejudice, language and cultural differences are among the difficulties faced in school by migrant children. After school the problems are more pronounced: they feel halfway between their parents’ culture and the Australian lifestyle
